Apple Magic Mouse: Pros and cons

For many people, the Apple Magic Mouse is a no-brainer. You use a Mac, so of course you use the official Apple mouse. It shows up regularly in our setups posts. And it helps that the input device is beautiful — so slim and sleek with no unsightly buttons or ports. It doesn’t need a scroll wheel either, as the mouse offers trackpad-style swiping and scrolling gestures.

Plus, the Bluetooth device recently got an upgrade, kicking the old Lightning charging port to the curb in favor of a USB-C port so it charges with the same cable as a MacBook or other Apple device.

It works with your Mac, MacBook and iPad, and is trim enough to go where you need it, fitting easily in a backpack or even a pocket.

All that said, the Apple Magic Mouse certainly has detractors. The most notable criticism is that it maintains its sleek appearance by putting the charging port on the bottom so the input device can’t be used while getting juiced up.

Need help making up your mind? Read our review.

Choose the version with a white multitouch surface, and the usual price is $79. But thanks to this Apple Magic Mouse deal, you pay $67.99 instead.
